WRITING.TEXT: When I was volunteering in Thailand last year, the country was placed under martial law and then the armed forces launched a coup. During that time, the country was placed under a curfew. Several days after the curfew was announced during the weekend, a group of us, including Thai and Western volunteers, were visiting a local city where there was a heavy military presence. Several drinks were consumed and before we know it, we're racing back to base to avoid being out after curfew. We had to go through several road blocks with the Thai volunteers hiding under blankets so that the military just sees a bunch of white tourists driving around. It was incredibly scary.
Truth!

WRITING.TITLE: Quiz: Are You More Sam or Dean?

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! I couldn't put my finger on it, but it's been less telenovela. That's exactly it.

I liked this episode much better than the previous one, but I'm just not crazy about the story arcs they have right now. I miss Petra's crazy mom, and Rose, and all the shocking twists! I mean, how many times can we see Jane and Rafael fight/disagree in their relationship or Michael mope about Jane before it gets boring?
DUN, DUN, DUN!
And I thought Rogelio shot himself in the foot with his conversation with Xo. Rafael just keeps saying the wrong thing! I'm trying to like you, Rafael, but you keep screwing up!
Shit! You were right! I can't believe Andie knew that Jane is also Michael's ex!
No! Petra! Don't look at him that way! Stop it!
I'm getting the vibe that it's just going to be super awkward and funny. I hope they stay friends though. She needs more girlfriends.
Right? That was a bitch move.
That part cracked me up!
Oh, god. I hope not. We've been down that road and it didn't turn out that great before!
What do you mean?

We are in this together. I love you.
THEN START ACTING LIKE IT, RAFAEL.

Michael + Rogelio = best bromance ever
Edit: Jane! Don't break them up!

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] "Chapter 17" (S01E17, Apr. 6th, 2015)
WRITING.TEXT: Rafael reacts poorly to a crisis at the hotel, leading Jane to wonder how he'll face parenthood. Meanwhile, Alba disapproves of Xo's living arrangement; Michael and Rogelio help out one another; and Petra feels uneasy after she uncovers a huge secret.

Ray: "I love you!"
Felicity: "Uh, gotta go. Jello. Bye."
OH, SHIT. HE'S GOING PUBLIC.

There were two blood samples from the house that night. One was Adult Barry's blood and the other they couldn't identify. They just know that it wasn't Harrison Wells' blood that they had on file. It was Eobard's blood like /u/Seagod12 mentioned!
I use both ends of the q-tip on each ear, using two q-tips to clean my ears. I want to make sure I get all the wax outta there!

WRITING.TITLE: No new episode tonight :(
WRITING.TEXT: I got so excited. I thought we were getting a new episode tonight. I've been looking forward to it all day, but there won't be a new episode until April 6. Now I'm sad :(
Not very good. Due to poor brakes and wet roads, I landed my car in a ditch this morning.
I agree. The whole writing workshop was lame. Even the flashbacks were boring. Michael and Rogelio's bromance was the only thing I liked about this episode.

I wonder how Andie play out in the plot.
Edit: Oh, so *that's* how Andie comes into the storyline.
I love these doggie subtitles!
Rogelio is so funny!

Because I've known her longer than you.
Shots fired.
Me too.

Well, I do handle guns for a living.
Michael, I love you.
Sorry again, /u/fatpinkchicken! I just love talking about this show live!

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] "Chapter 16" (S01E16, Mar. 16th, 2015)
WRITING.TEXT:
First aired: March 16, 2015
Jane considers attending a romance-writing workshop to get over a case of writer's block. Meanwhile, Rogelio asks to shadow Michael to gain greater insight into portraying a cop; Rafael must ask Rogelio for a favor; and a rift occurs between Xo and Alba.
What did you have for breakfast?
That movie was cussing amazing.
The Earth King has invited you to /r/LakeLaogai.
There's no point in hating my abuser because he will never recognize that he is a monster and therefore will never change.
This is the correct answer.
The Last Airbender. Can't get any worse than it already is.

A hug from my mom.
My parents moved across the country almost 2 years ago for my dad's job. I stayed here for my job and college. I haven't seen my parents for almost a year. I miss getting a hug from my mom at the end of a rough day.
Then the show pulls something like this, and I just want Jane and Michael back together.
I can't decide who I think is best with Jane. I go back and forth almost every episode.

Ouch, Jane.
While it might be true, that was a little harsh.
Really, both of them? Ugh.
Xo, don't play those kinds of games.
OH, NO HE DIDN'T! That's so cute!

Soul crushing, frankly.
Lol.
Young Jane is so cute.
It would give Felicity some well needed character development.
I picked Lance to die too, but it hurt my heart to click. He brings such intensity as an actor when he's on the screen that I'd hate to see him go.
Yeah, Akio is so dead. But I'd be very disappointed if Roy died.
I put Lyla as on option, but then went back and thought about it. If Lyla dies, Dig has to be with baby Sara. He'd put out of action since there wouldn't be anyone else to care for her.

WRITING.TITLE: [Spoiler S3E19] POLL: Who do you think it will be?
[Off Topic] About to find out what all the fuss is about.
WRITING.TEXT:
So I always see comments on this sub about how when Ray was first introduced that they couldn't see anyone else but Shaw from Chuck. I mean, people had such intense reactions to him and I never understood it. He's just the bad guy in another show, right?
Well, I'm finally going to understand. I'm about to start season 3 of Chuck and I'm excited! Arrow is the first time I've ever seen Brandon Routh act and all I know him as is Ray Palmer/A.T.O.M./Olicity crusher. I've never seen him Chuck or Superman or anything else. It's going to be interesting having such a different take on this that I just wanted to share!
